text: Fargher is a former community in Sherman County, Oregon, United States. It was founded by Arthur W. Fargher, a native of the Isle of Man, who arrived in Oregon in 1878. The community's rail station was located near the Sherars Bridge. It is contemporarily considered a ghost town. ==References== Category:1878 establishments in Oregon Category:Populated places established in 1878 Category:Ghost towns in Oregon Category:Unincorporated communities in Sherman County, Oregon
title: Fargher, Oregon
